intro: Anemia wettsteinii, commonly known as the Wettstein's anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in meadows and forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
